topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: What's In The Build

body.p: HP Helion OpenStack is a commercial-grade distribution of OpenStack the leading open source cloud computing platform. This distribution, backed by HP, enables customers to more easily build, manage, and use open-source based hybrid clouds in a resilient, maintainable platform. HP Helion OpenStack enables cost-effective scalability of IT services and business agility and, as part of the HP Helion portfolio, it is backed by a wide range of related cloud products, services, and professional support.
In the Helion OpenStack 2.0 release, these are the features you can expect:

ul.li:
Baremetal install that includes:
updating the configuration
adding nodes
adding VSA, etc
Full set of Kilo-based OpenStack services
NIC bonding, Multi-NIC support, and Network separation (including VLAN
VSA as a Cinder block storage provider
Multiple Provider VLANs as external networks

section.title: Full set of Kilo-based OpenStack services
LBaaS
section.p: LBaaS (Load-Balancing-as-a-Service) is a Neutron extension that introduces a load balancing feature set. Helion OpenStack 2.0 includes the V2 version which allows flexible load balancing of multiple ports on one VIP. The included reference implementation uses haproxy but 3rd party Load Balancers can be integrated as well. In case that a 3rd party driver doesnâ€™t exist for LBaaS V2 installing LBaaS V1 instead of V2 is supported.

section.title: FWaaS
section.p: FWaaS (FireWall-as-a-Service) is a Neutron extension that introduces a firewall feature set. The included reference implementation is using iptables to block traffic but 3rd party Firewalls can be integrated with this extension into Helion OpenStack as well.
